name: df-gim
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2
body: |- wceq(cgim, cmpo(s0, s1, cgrp, cgrp, crab(s2, co(cv(s0), cghm, cv(s1)), wf1o(cv(s2), cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), cfv(cbs, cv(s1))))))
bodyPretty: ⊢ GrpIso =(s0 ∈ Grp, s1 ∈ Grp ↦ { s2 ∈(s0[GrpHom]s1)|(s2 :(Base ` s0)↔(Base ` s1))})
comment: An isomorphism of groups is a homomorphism which is also a bijection, i.e. it preserves equality as well as the group operation. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 21-Jan-2015.)
